intro: Phlogacanthus latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf phlogacanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological features. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
